list.description: The architectures of the VMs (`i386` \| `x86_64`).

bool.description: Whether the BSU volumes are deleted when terminating the VMs.

list.description: The device names for the BSU volumes (in the format `/dev/sdX`, `/dev/sdXX`, `/dev/xvdX`, or `/dev/xvdXX`).
The states for the BSU volumes (`attaching` \| `attached` \| `detaching` \| `detached`).
The volume IDs of the BSU volumes.
The idempotency tokens provided when launching the VMs.
The IDs of the OMIs used to launch the VMs.

bool.description: Whether the source/destination checking is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

list.description: The names of the keypairs used when launching the VMs.
The numbers for the VMs when launching a group of several VMs (for example, `0`, `1`, `2`, and so on).
Whether the VMs are Spot Instances (spot).
The descriptions of the NICs.

bool.description: Whether the source/destination checking is enabled (true) or disabled (false).
Whether the NICs are deleted when the VMs they are attached to are deleted.

list.description: The device numbers the NICs are attached to.
The IDs of the NIC attachments.
The states of the attachments.
The IDs of the VMs the NICs are attached to.
The association IDs returned when the public IPs were associated with the NICs.
The allocation IDs returned when the public IPs were allocated to their accounts.
The public IPs associated with the NICs.
The Media Access Control (MAC) addresses of the NICs.
The IDs of the NICs.
The public IPs associated with the private IPs.

bool.description: Whether the private IPs are the primary IPs associated with the NICs.

list.description: The private IPs of the NICs.
The IDs of the security groups associated with the NICs.
The names of the security groups associated with the NICs.
The states of the NICs (`available` \| `in-use`).
The IDs of the Subnets for the NICs.
The platforms. Use windows if you have Windows VMs. Otherwise, leave this filter blank.
The private IPs of the VMs.
The product codes associated with the Image used to create the VMs.
The public IPs of the VMs.
The IDs of the reservation of the VMs, created every time you launch VMs. These reservation IDs can be associated with several VMs when you lauch a group of VMs using the same launch request.
The names of the root devices for the VMs (for example, `/dev/sda1`)
The root devices types used by the VMs (always `ebs`)

set.description: The IDs of the security groups for the VMs (only in the public Cloud).

list.description: The names of the security groups for the VMs (only in the public Cloud).
The reason codes for the state changes.
The messages describing the state changes.
The reasons explaining the current states of the VMs. This filter is like the `StateReasonCodes` one.
The IDs of the Subnets for the VMs.
The keys of the tags associated with the VMs.
The values of the tags associated with the VMs.
The key/value combination of the tags associated with the VMs, in the following format: "Filters":{"Tags":["TAGKEY=TAGVALUE"]}.
The tenancies of the VMs (`dedicated` \| `default` \| `host`).
The IDs of the security groups for the VMs.
The names of the security group for the VMs.
The state codes of the VMs: `-1` (quarantine), `0` (pending), `16` (running), `32` (shutting-down), `48` (terminated), `64` (stopping), and `80` (stopped).
The state names of the VMs (`pending` \| `running` \| `stopping` \| `stopped` \| `shutting-down` \| `terminated` \| `quarantine`).
The NumSpot VM types.
The IDs of the Vpcs in which the VMs are running.
The IDs of the Vpcs where the NICs are located.
The Subregions where the NICs are located.
The names of the Subregions of the VMs.
One or more IDs of VMs.

string.description: The architecture of the VM (`i386` \| `x86_64`).

bool.description: If true, the volume is deleted when terminating the VM. If false, the volume is not deleted when terminating the VM.

string.description: The date and time of attachment of the volume to the VM, in ISO 8601 date-time format.
The state of the volume.
The ID of the volume.

single_nested.description: Information about the created BSU volume.

string.description: The name of the device.

list_nested.description: The block device mapping of the VM.

string.description: The idempotency token provided when launching the VM.
The date and time of creation of the VM.

bool.description: If true, you cannot delete the VM unless you change this parameter back to false.

string.description: The hypervisor type of the VMs (`ovm` \| `xen`).
The ID of the VM.
The ID of the Image used to create the VM.
The VM behavior when you stop it. If set to `stop`, the VM stops. If set to `restart`, the VM stops then automatically restarts. If set to `terminate`, the VM stops and is deleted.

bool.description: (Vpc only) If true, the source/destination check is enabled. If false, it is disabled. This value must be false for a NAT VM to perform network address translation (NAT) in a Vpc.

string.description: The name of the keypair used when launching the VM.

int64.description: The number for the VM when launching a group of several VMs (for example, `0`, `1`, `2`, and so on).

bool.description: If true, nested virtualization is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

string.description: The description of the NIC.

bool.description: (Vpc only) If true, the source/destination check is enabled. If false, it is disabled. This value must be false for a NAT VM to perform network address translation (NAT) in a Vpc.
If true, the NIC is deleted when the VM is terminated.

int64.description: The device index for the NIC attachment (between `1` and `7`, both included).

string.description: The ID of the NIC to attach.
The state of the attachment (`attaching` \| `attached` \| `detaching` \| `detached`).

The public IP associated with the NIC.

The name of the security group.

The ID of the Subnet for the NIC.
The ID of the Vpc for the NIC.

list_nested.description: (Vpc only) The network interface cards (NICs) the VMs are attached to.

string.description: Indicates the operating system (OS) of the VM.
The performance of the VM (`medium` \| `high` \|  `highest`).
The name of the Subregion. If you specify this parameter, you must not specify the `Nics` parameter.
The tenancy of the VM (`default`, `dedicated`, or a dedicated group ID).

single_nested.description: Information about the placement of the VM.

string.description: The name of the private DNS.
The primary private IP of the VM.

list.description: The product codes associated with the Image used to create the VM.

string.description: The name of the public DNS.
The public IP of the VM.
The reservation ID of the VM.
The name of the root device for the VM (for example, `/dev/sda1`).
The type of root device used by the VM (always `bsu`).
The ID of the security group.

set_nested.description: One or more security groups associated with the VM.

string.description: The state of the VM (`pending` \| `running` \| `stopping` \| `stopped` \| `shutting-down` \| `terminated` \| `quarantine`).
The reason explaining the current state of the VM.
The ID of the Subnet for the VM.
The key of the tag, with a minimum of 1 character.
The value of the tag, between 0 and 255 characters.

list_nested.description: One or more tags associated with the VM.

string.description: The type of VM.
The Base64-encoded MIME user data.
The ID of the Vpc in which the VM is running.

list_nested.description: Information about one or more VMs.

bool.description: By default or if set to true, the volume is deleted when terminating the VM. If false, the volume is not deleted when terminating the VM.

int64.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). This parameter must be specified only if you create an `io1` volume. The maximum number of IOPS allowed for `io1` volumes is `13000` with a maximum performance ratio of 300 IOPS per gibibyte.

string.description: The ID of the snapshot used to create the volume.

int64.description:
The size of the volume, in gibibytes (GiB).
If you specify a snapshot ID, the volume size must be at least equal to the snapshot size.
If you specify a snapshot ID but no volume size, the volume is created with a size similar to the snapshot one.

string.description: The type of the volume (`standard` \| `io1` \| `gp2`). If not specified in the request, a `standard` volume is created.
The date and time of attachment of the volume to the VM, in ISO 8601 date-time format.
The state of the volume.
The ID of the volume.

single_nested.description: Information about the BSU volume to create.

string.description: The device name for the volume. For a root device, you must use `/dev/sda1`. For other volumes, you must use `/dev/sdX`, `/dev/sdXX`, `/dev/xvdX`, or `/dev/xvdXX` (where the first `X` is a letter between `b` and `z`, and the second `X` is a letter between `a` and `z`).
Removes the device which is included in the block device mapping of the Image.
The name of the virtual device (`ephemeralN`).

list_nested.description: One or more block device mappings.

string.description: A unique identifier which enables you to manage the idempotency.

bool.description: If true, you cannot delete the VM unless you change this parameter back to false.

string.description: The ID of the Image used to create the VM. You can find the list of OMIs by calling the [ReadImages](#readimages) method.
The name of the keypair.

bool.description: (dedicated tenancy only) If true, nested virtualization is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

string.description: The name of the Subregion. If you specify this parameter, you must not specify the `Nics` parameter.
The tenancy of the VM (`default`, `dedicated`, or a dedicated group ID).

One or more names of security groups for the VMs.

string.description: The ID of the Subnet in which you want to create the VM. If you specify this parameter, you must not specify the `Nics` parameter.
The type of VM.
Data or script used to add a specific configuration to the VM. It must be Base64-encoded and is limited to 500 kibibytes (KiB).
The VM behavior when you stop it. By default or if set to `stop`, the VM stops. If set to `restart`, the VM stops then automatically restarts. If set to `terminate`, the VM stops and is terminated.
